song.englishname: The Whiskey Ain't Workin' -- duet with Marty Stuart

english.segment1: There was a time I could drink my cares away. And drown out all of the heartaches that hurt me night and day. When the thought of you came crashin' through I'd have one more. But now the whiskey ain't workin' anymore
english.segment2: I need one good honky tonk angel to turn my life around. That's reason enough for me to lay this old bottle down. A woman warm and willing is what I'm looking for. 'Cause the whiskey ain't workin' anymore
english.segment3: They knew my name at every bar in town. And they knew all of the reasons why I was coming round, round, round. 'Cause in my mind peace I'd find when they'd start to pour. But now the whiskey ain't workin' anymore
english.segment4: I need one good honky tonk angel to turn my life around. That's reason enough for me to lay this old bottle down. A woman warm and willing is what I'm looking for. 'Cause the whiskey ain't workin' anymore
english.segment5: Lord the whiskey ain't workin' anymore. That's for sure!
